title: RL33161
content: The Joint Tactical Radio System (JTRS) is a Department of Defense (DOD) program thatwould play a significant role in the U.S Army's proposed Future Combat System (FCS) program. (For a more detailed description of the FCS program see CRS Report RL32888 , The Army's FutureCombat System(FCS): Background and Issues for Congress , by [author name scrubbed].) JTRS,envisioned as a family of software programmable radios, has been described as the "backbone" ofthe FCS and is intended to link the 18 manned and unmanned systems that would constitute FCS.Two JTRS sub-programs managed by the Army -- Cluster One and Cluster Five -- have experienceddevelopmental difficulties, delays, and cost overruns which calls into question their viability. Thisreport will be updated on a periodic basis.
